SENT.plain: Prostaglandin E therapy in infants causes periosteal elevation
Although the changes usually take 30-40 days to become visible, we have seen them as early as nine days
In 15 infants who had prostaglandin E therapy for over six days, three developed periosteal elevation
Three other cases are described in greater detail, with long-term follow-up in two in which the bone remodeled to normal
Gallium scan in one showed increased uptake in areas involved

The periosteal cloaking may mimic Caffey disease but the pattern of involvement is different, since the mandible, which is commonly affected in Caffey disease, is rarely involved in prostaglandin E therapy
